subject: Communication
title: Building a Conflict-Competent Culture
description: A micro-lesson that makes Building a Conflict-Competent Culture usable.

hook.text: Some organizations resolve conflicts in hours. Others let them fester for years.

buildup.text: A conflict-competent culture normalizes disagreement, provides tools for resolution, and rewards honest dialogue.

twist.text: Most organizations train technical skills extensively but invest nothing in conflict resolution skills.

climax.text: Conflict-competent cultures don't fear disagreement. They build systems that channel it constructively.

punchline.text: The best cultures don't avoid storms. They build better ships.
